Sentence: In addition, the superconducting state of ZrB 2 , observed at 5.5 K, was attributed to the presence of a secondary phase, identified as ZrB 12 , which is an already known superconductor whose T c = 5.95 K .

Among the intermetallic compounds, the binary diborides have been the most studied in the last decade since magnesium diboride compound (MgB 2 ) showed superconductivity with transition temperature of 39 K [1].
A superconducting transition was observed for all x values studied, despite the non-superconducting matrix ZrB 2 , which indicates that the superconducting state is induced by the presence of Nb.
The superconducting transition temperature was found to be lim- ited to a maximum of 8.1 K, considerably lower than that of MgB 2 .
The results show that the critical temperature increases with Nb content, reaching its maximum (T c = 8.1 K) for x = 0.04.
